channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Cr Southhampton Row and High holborn, 13th June
item.description:
You have explained previously that this telephone box is privately owned and the owners have been made aware of the unsatisfactory situation. Clearly the owners don’t care!! It is a complete mess, and looks terrible with the door hanging askew, a torn and broken curtain in front and obscene postcards on the sides. This is a main through fare to the British Museum and does not leave tourists with a good impression of London, in addition to being an eyesore to residents and workers in the area. Location - Corner High Holborn and Southhampton Row.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southampton Row, Holborn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown hedge etc, 13th June
item.description:
URGENT. You are aware of this problem as you erected this barrier a very long time ago. Despite numerous reports by others nothing more has been done. There are several disabled people who require assistance to walk who pass regularly and when cars are parked there it’s very difficult. You have also been informed about the huge overhanging tree branch. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wynford Way, Coldharbour, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose bricks and hole, 13th June
item.description:
Sunken bricks on block paving creating a hole outside the house of an elderly lady - it is a trip hazzard on the pavement for older people and children - tripping into the path of oncoming traffics . On the junction of Herbert & Salisbury road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Herbert Road, Southborough, London

item.title: Shrub cuttings left by Southwark Council pruning stafc, 13th June
item.description:
It has been several weeks since Southwark Council gardening team has cut a blackberry Bush behind the disable bay parking space. This is adjacent to Birdsall House. Unfortunately no one returned to collect the pruned bushes, which have extremely sharp thorns on them. Left on the floor they are a danger when items are taken to and from the boot of cars parked there. Please can someone come and remove the mess. This happened last year and I am again writing in about this.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Estate Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pelham Road, Anerley, London

item.title: Public bin needed., 13th June
item.description:
People consuming food and drink from nearby shops need a public bin to use to discard their litter. Because there isn't one there, people just litter the road near Pleydell Avenue and in front of the shops (42 Anerley Road). Please provide a public litter bin.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Anerley Hill, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet
